thread.title: Mets' Terry Collins only looking for 2-year deal, report says
thread.title_full: Mets' Terry Collins only looking for 2-year deal, report says

author: Maria Guardado | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Mets' Terry Collins only looking for 2-year deal, report says
text:
However, Collins is not interested in a long-term deal and would only look to sign on for two more years, according to a report from CBS Sports' Jon Heyman . 
"Collins, 66, is telling friends he wants to spend time with his wife and do things while he's still vital, so two years is the right number," Heyman writes. "He has blanched at the idea of even three years, according to friends." 
PLUS : Tom Coughlin and Terry Collins are text message buddies 
There were points earlier in the season when Collins' return appeared in doubt, as he only had a team option for 2016 in his contract. Still, Collins managed to keep the Mets level-headed over the course of their roller coaster season and is now guiding them through a lengthy postseason run. He's also in the discussion for NL Manager of the Year . 
As Heyman notes, Collins is "looking forward" to leading the Mets next season, where they'll once again be stacked with dynamic young pitching, which could make them a force for years to come. 
Collins made $1.1 million as manager of the Mets this season.
